comment._content:
The original Brooklyn Institute design was projected to encompass over two and a half million square feet, which would have produced the largest museum building in the world.

After Brooklyn was incorporated into the City of Greater New York on January 1, 1898, funds for large-scale local projects became much harder to find. As a result, only one-sixth of the original design was actually constructed.
